intro: Senecio chirripoensis, commonly known as the Chirripó senecio, is a flowering plant native to Costa Rica. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests, where it thrives in the humid, cool conditions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
